page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Dagnall village would now be regarded as a commuter village, but before the new houses were built there were some interesting existing buildings which have now disappeared.The pound bank was a row of houses in a horseshoe shape. There were three shops in the village. Two of these were turned into houses and the third was turned into the Golden Rule public house.The new general store was built eight years ago.There was a bakery and wheelwrights shop and a brewery.Local legend has it that the brewer threw pieces of meat into the beer to give it more flavour. There were kennels in Deans Meadow before all the modern development and a tramp ward for tramps to sleep in overnight before continuing their travels.
